author: St. Augustine
quote: The confession of evil works is the first beginning of good works.

author: St. Augustine
quote: In failing to confess, Lord, I would only hide You from myself, not myself from You.

author: St. John Climacus
quote: Confession is like a bridle that keeps the soul which reflects on it from committing sin, but anything left unconfessed we continue to do without fear as if in the dark.

author: St. Josemaria Escriva
quote: At the time of your examination(of sins) beware of the devil that ties your tongue.

author: Pope St. Gregory the Great
quote: To do penance is to bewail the evil we have done, and to do no evil to bewail.

author: St. Thomas Aquinas
quote: Three conditions are necessary for Penance: contrition, which is sorrow for sin, together with a purpose of amendment; confession of sins without any omission; and satisfaction by means of good works.

author: St. Isidore of Seville
quote: Confession heals, confession justifies, confession grants pardon of sin, all hope consists in confession; in confession there is a chance for mercy.

author: St. Thomas Aquinas
quote: The minister to whom confession is made is the delegate of Christ, Who is the Judge of the living and the dead.

author: St. Elizabeth Ann Seton
quote: Our Lord Himself I saw in this venerable Sacrament . . . I felt as if my chains fell, as those of St. Peter at the touch of the Divine messenger. My God, what new scenes for my soul!

author: St. Faustina, Divine Mercy in My Soul
quote: A disobedient soul will win no victory, even if the Lord Jesus himself, in person, were to hear its confession.

author: Imitation of Christ
quote: A humble confession displeases Satan and, if he could, he would make you omit Holy Communion.

author: Pope St. John Paul 2
quote: Confession is an act of honesty and courage - an act of entrusting ourselves, beyond sin, to the mercy of a loving and forgiving God.

author: St. Chrysostom
quote: After confession a crown is given to penitents

author: St. Augustine
quote: If you excuse yourself in confession, you shut up sin within your soul, and shut out pardon.

author: St. Alphonsus Liguori
quote: Obedience to a confessor is the most acceptable offering which we can make to God, and the most secure way of doing the divine will.

author: St. John of the Cross
quote: Not to follow the advice of our confessor is pride and a want of faith.

author: St. John of the Cross
quote: Strive always to confess your sins with a deep knowledge of your own wretchedness and with clarity and purity.

author: 1 John 1:9
quote: If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just and will forgive us our sins and purify us from all unrighteousness.

author: St. Padre Pio
quote: The mercy of God will always be greater than your ingratitude.

author: St. John Vianney
quote: My children, we cannot comprehend the goodness of God towards us in instituting this great Sacrament of Penance.

author: Psalm 32:5
quote: Then I acknowledged my sin to you and did not cover up my iniquity. I said, 'I will confess my transgressions to the Lord.' And you forgave the guilt of my sin.

author: St. Catherine of Siena
quote: God is more ready to pardon than we have been to sin.

author: Pope Francis
quote: Confession is an encounter with Jesus whose mercy motivates us to do better.

author: St. Jerome
quote: No one is without sin. The only thing we can do is to confess our sins and repent.

author: Proverbs 28:13
quote: Whoever conceals their sins does not prosper, but the one who confesses and renounces them finds mercy.
